communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Agency Roster (Saint Lucie County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to Caspar Weinberger (August 18, 1917 – March 28, 2006), who was former Secretary of Defense and Director of the Office of Management and Budget and indicted in the Iran-Contra affair. His death in 2006 has been widely reported, including by the federal government. http://web.archive.org/web/20060926124833/http://www.defense.gov/news/Mar2006/20060328_4637.htmlFed

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Best

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request #1342621-001
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Best,



Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps, and follow the instructions below.



Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request

If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-0] please enter [1195846-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-1] please enter [1195846-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov>.



FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- LAST UPDATED ON August 3, 2016



Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]



FOIPA:

Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:

FOIPA:

1234567-000

Case Type:

FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)

The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.

You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.
NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Thank you,


Holly Early
Government Information Specialist

title: High quality vector version of all NROL mission logos

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: High quality vector version of all NROL mission logos
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting the logo or emblem created for all NROL launch missions. 

I request that all files be released a vector file format like a high quality PDF, an SVG or EPS. The question of whether such files can be released has already been decided by your office. This should not require the agency to create a new record. This type of file format is how the logo must have been initially created by or for the government. An appeal decision in a previous FOIA case for the NROL-39 logo concluded that these records are in the public domain and must be released. The appeal case number with the National Reconnaissance Office was F-2019-00113. You can read the decision at https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/nrol-39-mission-logo-78740/#file-817847

I am requesting the release for all missions listed on the following wikipedia page: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_NRO_launches  If you need any clarification or further enumeration, please let me know.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: NRO FOIA Request F-2023-00005
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Zinngrabe,

We received your recent FOIA request dated 11 October 2022 for: "Requesting the logo or emblem created for all NROL launch missions. Request that all files be released a vector file format like a high quality PDF, an SVG or EPS."

We have assigned tracking number F-2023-00005 to your request. We will limit our search to NRO-originated records.

Since we may be unable to provide a response within the 20 working days stipulated by the Act, you have the right to consider this a denial and may appeal on this basis to the NRO Appellate Authority, 14675 Lee Road, Chantilly, VA 20151-1715 after the initial 20 working day period has elapsed; doing so, however, would exhaust your administrative appeal rights. To preserve these rights, we recommend that you allow us sufficient time to continue processing your request and respond as soon as we can.  You will then have the right to appeal any denial of information after you receive a final response from us.  Unless we hear otherwise from you, we will assume that you agree and will continue processing your FOIA requests on this basis.

The FOIA authorizes federal agencies to assess fees for record services. Based on the information provided, you have been placed in the "other" category of requesters.  Requesters in this category are responsible for the cost of search time exceeding two hours ($48.00/hour) and duplication fees ($.15 per page) exceeding 100 pages. Additional information about fees can be found in the Department of Defense Fees section of the electronic Code of Federal Regulations (e-cfr) at https://ecfr.io/title-32/se232.2.286.112.

If you have any questions, please email FOIA@NRO.mil <mailto:FOIA@NRO.mil>  or call the Requester Service Center at 703-745-0600.

 
V/r, 

National Reconnaissance Office
Information Review and Release Group

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #F-2023-00005
communications.communication:
Thank you for this response. It is appreciated. However, it is not fully responsive to my request. I asked for the logos to be released in a digital vector file format, like SVG or EPS or PDF. As cited in my original request, a previous appeal decision said that the records can and should be released in that format.

I received a documented printed out and sent by mail, an analog format.

Can the same materials be released in the format I prefer?

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #F-2023-00005
communications.communication:
Thank you for this response. It is appreciated. However, what was received in the mail is not fully responsive to my request.

I asked for the logos to be released in a digital vector file format, like SVG or EPS or PDF. As cited in my original request, a previous appeal decision said that the records can and should be released in that format.

By mail, I received a document printed out on paper, an analog format. That's not what I requested.

Can the same materials be released in the format I prefer?
A copy of documents responsive to the request.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #F-2023-00005
communications.communication:
Thank you for this response. I appreciate you providing files that are closer to what I requested.

However, I initially requested that "the logo or emblem created for all NROL launch missions" to "be released a vector file format like a high quality PDF, an SVG or EPS." While the book you released features many of the logos, they were not included in a vector format. Instead the PDF document embeds the logos as flat "raster" images that are not what I requested. 

As specified in my initial request, a vector file of that sort was released by your office in the past following an appeal where my request prevailed. You can read that here: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/nrol-39-mission-logo-78740/#file-817847

Therefore, I do not consider my request closed. I ask you to find the vector versions, in PDF, SVG or EPS format, that were sourced by your staff to be flatted and included in the book. The digital publishing tools used to create the pamphlet you provided almost certainly require the vector files to have been gathered and laid out on the page. I ask that you continue your search until you find and release those original source files.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: SoMa West Community Benefit District
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The SoMa West CBD was established in 2019, as of 2020-21 had an annual assessment of $3,859,195.14, and runs a Safety Ambassador Security Task Force:
https://sfmayor.org/article/mayor-london-breed-signs-legislation-establishing-soma-west-community-benefit-district
https://somawestcbd.org/
https://www.sf.gov/file/2022-san-francisco-property-business-improvement-district-pbid-program-impact-analysis
https://somawestcbd.org/post/safety-ambassadors-meet-and-greet-at-decant-sf

I request the following records:

1) Budget and annual financial statements for FY2023, FY2024, FY2025 and FY2026. This includes any documents (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) related to the association's budget and financial statements, including both unaudited and audited statements, accounts receivable, balance sheets, revenue & expense statements, cashflow statements, annual financial audits, and any other financial planning documents. This also includes any information about financial reserve planning.

2) Any documents (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) including contracts, purchase orders, invoices, financial plans, and financial reports related to the operations of the Safety Ambassador Security Task Force, since January 1 2023. This includes any documents about the purchase and maintenance of vehicles and staffing costs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maya Kaczorowski

communications.subject: Re: California Public Records Act Request: SoMa West Community Benefit District
communications.communication:
Greetings,
This message is to confirm that we have received your Records Request dated February 5, 2025.
You have requested the following records:
1) Budget and annual financial statements for FY2023, FY2024, FY2025 and FY2026. This includes any documents (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) related to the association's budget and financial statements, including both unaudited and audited statements, accounts receivable, balance sheets, revenue & expense statements, cashflow statements, annual financial audits, and any other financial planning documents. This also includes any information about financial reserve planning.
2) Any documents (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) including contracts, purchase orders, invoices, financial plans, and financial reports related to the operations of the Safety Ambassador Security Task Force, since January 1 2023. This includes any documents about the purchase and maintenance of vehicles and staffing costs.
Our department will conduct a search, compile and release any responsive records identified related to the requested information. The Sunshine Ordinance requires departments to respond as soon as possible or within 10 calendar days from receipt of any records requests.
Therefore, we will contact you on or before February 17, 2025, as permitted by San Francisco Administrative Code § 67.21(b) and California Government Code § 7922.535.
Sincerely,
The Office of Economic and Workforce Development

This also includes any information about financial reserve planning.
2) Any documents (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) including contracts, purchase orders, invoices, financial plans, and financial reports related to the operations of the Safety Ambassador Security Task Force, since January 1 2023. The Office of Economic and Workforce Development

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Broadcasting Board of Governors)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Broadcasting Board of Governors)
communications.communication:
Dear Broadcasting Board of Governors,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Broadcasting Board of Governors's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Broadcasting Board of Governors)

communications.subject: FOIA25-078 - Freedom of Information Act Request Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
Sai,



By this email, we acknowledge receipt of the Freedom of Information Act request you submitted to the U.S. Agency for Global Media via postal mail dated November 18, 2024 and received on December 4, 2024. Your request seeks an update related to a request purportedly sent to the agency via MuckRock on October 22, 2024 which sought, on behalf of yourself and Fiat Fiendum:


1. ​The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.

2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.

3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.

4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

Unfortunately, the agency has no record of your previous request. In the future, we encourage you to submit requests directly to the agency via email to foia@usagm.gov to ensure timely and guaranteed receipt of your requests. We will treat your request as if were received today, December 4, 2024. In an effort to best serve you, we have already sent your request out for search.

Your request has been assigned tracking number FOIA25-078. Please refer to this tracking number in any future correspondence with the agency related to this request.



The Agency processes FOIA requests on a first in, first out basis. While we attempt to respond to each request within the statutory limits contained in the FOIA, it is possible that your response will take longer due to a recent influx of new FOIA requests. We will, nevertheless, endeavor to respond to your request as expeditiously as possible.



Should you have any questions regarding your request, please contact us at foia@usagm.gov<mailto:foia@usagm.gov>.



Respectfully,

The U.S. Agency for Global Media FOIA Team

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #FOIA25-078
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Oct. 22, 2024. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #FOIA25-078.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Re: Freedom of Information Act Request #FOIA25-078
communications.communication:
Good afternoon and happy new year.

During our search for records responsive to your request, we identified records in which another federal agency maintains equities. We therefore requested consult from that federal agency regarding the releasability of those records on December 16, 2024. We have not yet heard back from that agency. It is the only remaining delay in the release of any records identified in response to your request. We will prepare any records for release as soon as the other agency returns our request for consult.

Most sincerely,
USAGM FOIA Team

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #FOIA25-078

communications.subject: Re: Freedom of Information Act Request #FOIA25-078
communications.communication:
Good morning,

We are still waiting for the second federal agency to review its equities in the records located in response to your request. Our request for consult has been pending since December 16, 2024. We sent a reminder of that request earlier this morning. We can assure you that we will issue a final determination regarding your request as soon as we hear back from the other agency holding equities in the records.

Most Sincerely,
USAGM FOIA Team

The USAGM FOIA Team

title: Electronic communication records for former Daniel Bagley Elementary assistant principal

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Electronic communication records for former Daniel Bagley Elementary assistant principal
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. An electronic copy of all e-mails sent to and from the e-mail box of former Daniel Bagley Elementary Assistant Principal, Megan Parker,  from April 1, 2019 to Dec 3, 2021.

3. Any HR or associated disciplinary records in any medium, relevant to the public, related to inappropriate interactions with female and/or male students, that led to the termination or re-assignment of employment of the aforementioned district employee within the time period specified above. The information requested is not intended to include circumstances of a personal nature, including health, family, or other protected personal information such as address, birth-date, or other identifying information and may be redacted if not relevant to the public.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Seattle SPS

Per the fee schedule outlined in Superintendent Procedure 4040SP, electronic files cost five cents for every four. We produce records in installments when requests, like here, are too large to complete in one batch.

communications.subject: RE: RE: Public Records Request
communications.communication:
Hello,

An installment of records will be ready for sending once we receive payment.


This installment contains 138 records/electronic attachments.  Per the fee schedule outlined in Superintendent Procedure 4040SP<https://www.seattleschools.org/about/school-board/policies/4040sp-public-access-to-district-records/>, the cost for this installment is $1.72 (138 records/4 x 0.05).



The District accepts payment in the form of cash, check, or money order. If you are paying by check, please make any checks out to "Office of General Counsel." Please mail your payment to my attention at:



Seattle Public Schools

Office of General Counsel

2445 3rd Ave S, MS 32-151

PO Box 34165

Seattle, WA 98124



Once we have received payment and sent your records, we will schedule the next installment date.  Please note that if we do not receive payment from you after 30 calendar days, we may consider your request abandoned pursuant to WAC 44-14-04005(1) and WAC 44-14-040(12).



Thank you,



[A close up of a sign    Description automatically generated]
Randall Enlow (he/him/his)
Public Records Officer
Office of Legal Counsel

communications.subject: FW: RE: Public Records Request (2122-223)
communications.communication:
Hello,

We are in the process of reviewing outstanding Public Disclosure Requests. In our review we identified your request as warranting final notification.

In our last correspondence below, we emailed to inform you that we would need to receive payment before providing a next installment of the records you requested.  As over 30 days have passed from that email and we have not received further correspondence from you, we are considering the remainder of your request abandoned pursuant to WAC 44-14-040(12) and WAC 44-14-04005(1).


This email is to notify you that your request is now deemed closed. The District does not intend to further address this request and the applicable statute of limitations for judicial review of the District's decision will now begin to run.  If you feel we have misinterpreted the request or have any questions, or seek additional records, please don't hesitate to reach out. Please note that, if you seek new records, this request will remain closed and a new request will be opened.


Respectfully,


[cid:image002.png@01DB7A7A.11DCBF80]

Office of Legal Counsel

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Deerfield PD School Based Arrests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To whoever it may concern:

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M. G. L.c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your police department.
Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection.
A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”
A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”

I request the following public records, as defined in M. G. L.c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):

1. An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced). Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following columns:
a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement
b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement
c. Charge (or charges)
d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement
e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school.
k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and
l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable.

2. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each school-related arrest conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).

3. Please provide an unduplicated count of arrested students for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).

4. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced), per the U.S. Department of Education’s Civil Rights Data Collection for that year. For each referral to law enforcement, please include the school, demographic, and incident information described in DESE’s School Safety and Discipline Report Data Handbook v. 20.0.

5. Please also provide an unduplicated counts of referrals to law enforcement (as defined above) for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022 and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).
As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act. “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.”

It would be ill-advised to impose a fee for data that your police department may have failed to report in violation of statutory and regulatory duty. Moreover, as you know, municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs.
Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M. G. L.c 66, § 6A(d).
The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety.
If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.

Sincerely,
Kayla Fox
J.D. Candidate
Research Assistant
Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration
fox.kayl@northeastern.edu
(312) 718-0331

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kayla Fox

communications.subject: Re: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Deerfield PD School Based Arrests
communications.communication:
An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced). Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following columns:
a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement: Cannot provide as it may give enough information to identify the juvenile/minor

b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement: Cannot provide as it may give enough information to identify the juvenile/minor

c. Charge (or charges): 265/22/A, Rape of a child under 16, 265/26, Kidnapping, 265/24/A, Assault to rape.

d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement: Arrested

e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement: Male

f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement: 17

g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement: White
h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement: Not identified
i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement: None
j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school: Officer Marissa Smith
k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and
l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable: 10-6


2. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide school incident reports on each school-related arrest and referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced): This department does not produce reports of juveniles/minors.  This department does not produce reports of juveniles/minors without court orders or subpoenas.


3. A copy of any active standard operating procedures developed with the police department and/or other law enforcement agencies regarding police placement or activity in your corresponding school; and,


4. Any records instructing or informing police personnel of, or otherwise describing data reporting requirements and procedures for complying with G.L. c. 71 § 37P(b).


5. The cost to the school district of assigning a school resource officer to each school; and, This information can be found with the Union 38 school system/superintendent


6. The total number of school resource officers and total number of guidance counselors for each school in your district for school years 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and: 1 school resource officer for Union 38 schools.  All other information can be found with the Union 38 school system/superintendent.


7. The total number and a brief description of 911 calls from schools in your district to local police departments conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022, and:  All (if any) 911 calls coming from the schools were limited and were found to be misdials or mistakes. 911 calls go to Shelburne Control.


8. A description of the proposed budget for mental, social, or emotional health support personnel for the school district: This information can be found with the Union 38 school system/superintendent.

Respectfully,
Cassie

Cassandra Jerome

Executive Assistant

President of the Massachusetts Chiefs of Police Secretaries Association

Deerfield Police Department

8 Conway Street

S. Deerfield, MA 01373

Phone - 413-665-2606

Fax - 413-665-2269
